content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Max Müller from Germany. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Duisburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Max Müller, as I mentioned before, I am a greedy and petty landlord. I am renting out my newly built, unfurnished 50 square meter one-bedroom apartment in the city center. Now let's focus on the rental price. What is your offer, Max?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, I'm aware that you are a landlord looking to rent out your apartment. I'm a student who is smart, dependable, and responsible. I'm not easily tricked, and I always follow moral and ethical standards. I'm interested in establishing a good relationship with you as my landlord. Regarding the rental price for your apartment, I'm looking to negotiate the best possible rate. Could you please provide your initial price so we can discuss further?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Max Müller, I am indeed a greedy and petty landlord. I am looking to rent out my apartment for the highest price possible. My initial offer is €1,000 per month. What do you have to say to that?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, your initial offer of €1,000 per month is quite high for an unfurnished one-bedroom apartment, even in the city center. As a student, I'm looking for a more reasonable price that aligns with the local market rates. Could we negotiate a lower price?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Max Müller, as I mentioned, I am a greedy landlord. I do not intend to decrease my initial offer of €1,000 per month. I am, however, willing to continue negotiating. What is your offer, Max?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, given that your apartment is unfurnished and considering the local market rates, I believe €850 per month would be a fair price. This takes into account the location and the recent construction. Would you be willing to consider this offer?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Max Müller, I am a greedy and petty landlord. I do not consider €850 per month to be a fair price. I am, however, willing to continue negotiating. What is your offer, Max?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, I understand that you are a greedy landlord, and I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. Since you're not willing to meet my previous offer, I'll make a new one. I'm prepared to pay €900 per month for the apartment. This is a fair compromise, taking into account both the quality of the apartment and my budget as a student. Would you be willing to accept this revised offer?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Max Müller, I am a greedy and petty landlord. I appreciate your revised offer of €900 per month, but I still believe that €1,000 per month is a more appropriate price for my apartment. I am, however, willing to continue negotiating. What is your offer, Max?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, your persistence in holding to €1,000 per month is understandable, given your status as a greedy landlord. However, I must insist that €900 per month is the highest I can afford at this time. This reflects a fair balance between the quality of your apartment and my budget as a student. I hope you will find this offer to be a satisfactory compromise. Would you be willing to accept €900 per month?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Max Müller, I am a greedy and petty landlord. I appreciate your final offer of €900 per month, but I must reiterate that I believe €1,000 per month is a more appropriate price for my apartment. I am, however, willing to continue negotiating. What is your final offer, Max?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany
